column4: alright, has anyone used MPD to set up a home media server before?
No but I used apache w/apachesound which is a web-based script to allow streaming of music
ampache actually I think it's called
i've got a NAS with all my music on it, and i'm planning to have a small laptop set up permanently as the audio device (attached will be a usb sound device with speakers)
the laptop/server will have access to the NAS. i want to be able to hit the server from any of my other pc's and queue up music to play
e.g. if i'm on my bed with my laptop, i want to be able to queue up a playlist, then turn off my laptop and go to bed while the music keeps playing
do you know of any gtk clients for ampache?
unfortunately I do not. However, it is web-based an almost out of the box easy to use.
eh, yeah, not looking to control my media library via a browser. hmm
theoretically i would also like to be able to redirect sound from my laptop or any other machine through this thing
i plan to use pulseaudio for that
